com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getCompleteOrderDetails

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getCompleteOrderDetails

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getCompleteOrderDetails(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getCompleteOrderDetails API returns detailed information about a specific order.

    • Method Detail

      • getCompleteOrderDetails

        org.w3c.dom.Document getCompleteOrderDetails(YFSEnvironment env,
                                             org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                      throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                             java.rmi.RemoteException
        The getCompleteOrderDetails API returns detailed information about a specific order. In addition to the information returned by the getOrderDetails API, geCompleteOrderDetails can also return information about shipments, containers, return orders and exchange orders associated with the order.
        While the getCompleteOrderDetails API may be invoked on any order document type, is recommended for use with sales order document types. The information returned, such as associated return orders and shipment information, are most logical for a sales order document.
        Additionally, the getCompleteOrderDetails API can be used to return only a few order lines at a time. These can be based on a maximum number of order lines to return, or the user can specify the exact order lines to appear in the output. When run with a subset of the order's lines, the getSalesOrderDetails API will only return work order, shipment, container, return order and exchange order information specific to the order lines being returned.
        If the getCompleteOrderDetails API is called on a return Order it will appear as the main order and the return element will be empty if present. Similarly if called on an exchangeOrder the information for the original order and for the return which is being exchanged will be ommitted by this API.
        Because an order can have a shipment that includes multiple lines, the information on the shipment is returned at the order header level, with only identifying information appearing under each order line to indicate what shipments, if any, that line is included in. The same is true for shipment containers, work orders, and return orders.

        If the getCompleteOrderDetails API is invoked with the SortingType attribute set to ITEM, order lines are sorted based on item id in ascending order. If order lines have relationship then it returns related lines below parent line and sorts related lines by item id within a relationship type. If the getCompleteOrderDetails API is invoked for a subset of order lines and if this set does not contain the parent order line then it will sort the order lines only based on item id.

        The getCompleteOrderDetails API can also return an OverallStatus attribute for orders and order lines. This attribute's value is based on the user exit YFSGetOverallStatusUE. See the "User Exits" section for more information.

        The getCompleteOrderDetails API can return whether modifications are allowed for a specific set of modification types. The modifications to be checked for should be passed in the Modifications/@Modification attribute for Orders and Order Lines.

        The getCompleteOrderDetails API can return bundle components for a line based on the GetBundleComponents on the Order Line.

        The getCompleteOrderDetails API can return information about the lines which are available for cancellation or stop delivery.

        The getCompleteOrderDetails API is used to determine what part of an order can be modified in the Increase Line Quantity, Cancel Order, and Change Delivery Option tasks of the Store Order Management user interface.This API checks if the specific Modification Type passed in the input is allowed for the order lines on the order. Please note that this API only considers a Modification Level of ORDER_LINE for this check. If the given Modification Type is not allowed based on the status modification rule configuration, the API checks to see if any of the order line quantity is owned by the Local Ship Node passed as input. The quantity is considered to be owned by the Local Ship Node when the order status records for that order line have been assigned to the Ship Node. If the quantity is owned by the Local Ship Node, then the API will include this quantity in the quantity that is allowed for modification. This will allow the user interface to present the appropriate modifiable quantity in the tasks mentioned above.

        The getCompleteOrderDetails API provides local ship node override support. The input can take LocalShipNode and StatusModificationType * and provide attributes like HasLocalShipment ModificationAllowed, ModificationQty, PreReleaseModificationQty, PostReleaseModificationQty, ModificationReleaseKey in the output.
        The getCompleteOrderDetails API reads the COM rules, YCD_CANCEL_PICKUP_LINES and YCD_CANCEL_DEL_LINES to determine whether to allow modification of order lines post-release.

        The getCompleteOrderDetails API returns a SupportLevel attribute which depicts the support level of the order based on order tags for the ApplicationCode and ApplicationVersion passed in the input. Only tags of type Y.COMPATIBILITY are considered when determining the SupportLevel attribute to be returned in the API output. The SupportLevel attribute can take one of the following values based on the scenario.
        Minimum - If any of the tags is not valid for the ApplicationCode and ApplicationVersion passed in the input and the SupportLevel defined for the invalid tag is Minimum, SupportLevel=Minimum is returned.
        Medium - If any of the tags is not valid for the ApplicationCode and ApplicationVersion passed in the input and the SupportLevel defined for the invalid tag is Medium, SupportLevel=Medium is returned.
        Full - In cases other than the ones listed above, SupportLevel=Full is returned. If the output template contains SupportLevel, but ApplicationCode, ApplicationVersion are not present in the input, the error code YFS10460 will be thrown by the API.

        Order Hierarchy

        If an order has a TransactionalRelationship with other orders such that RelationshipType is PARENT then a hierarchical structure may be obtained.

        This hierarchical structure will be built based on the OrderHierarchy element in the template.

        As an example, below is the hierarchy tree of the orders and its XML representation. 

                                   Order-1
                              |
               _______________|______________________
              |               |                      |
           Order-11        Order-12               Order-13
              |                                      |
         _____|_____                        _________|_________          
        |           |                      |                   |    
   Order-111   Order-112              Order-131            Order-132
                                                               |
                                                      _________|_________
                                                     |                   |
                                                Order-1321          Order-1322

        <OrderHierarchy>
  <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-1" OrderNo="Order-1" Status="Created">
    <ChildOrderList>
      <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-11" OrderNo="Order-11" Status="Created">
        <ChildOrderList>
          <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-111" OrderNo="Order-111" Status="Created">
          <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-112" OrderNo="Order-112" Status="Created">
        </ChildOrderList>
      </Order>
      <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-12" OrderNo="Order-12" Status="Created">
      <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-13" OrderNo="Order-13" Status="Created">
        <ChildOrderList>
          <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-131" OrderNo="Order-131" Status="Created">
          <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-132" OrderNo="Order-132" Status="Created">
            <ChildOrderList>
              <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-1321" OrderNo="Order-1321" Status="Created">
              <Order DocumentType="0001" EnterpriseCode="DEFAULT" OrderHeaderKey="Order-1322" OrderNo="Order-1322" Status="Created">
            </ChildOrderList>
          </Order>
        </ChildOrderList>
      </Order>
    </ChildOrderList>
  </Order>
</OrderHierarchy>

        Custom Attributes

        Note: This is template managed.

        If custom attributes are created and assigned, then you can display the custom attributes' details. These details are listed as attributes under the <Attribute> element, which is a child of the <CustomAttributes> element.

        Example:

              <Order . . . . >
            <CustomAttributes Contract="NONE" ForRenewal="N">
                  <Attribute AllowMultipleValues="" AllowedValueLength="" AttributeDomainID="" AttributeGroupID="" AttributeID="Contract"AttributeKey=""
                           AttributePostFix="" DataType="" DerivedFromAttributeKey="" IsAllowedValueDefined="" IsValueMandatory="" LongDescription="" 
                           OrganizationCode="" Se-quenceNo="" ShortDescription="" Contract="NONE" />
                            <Attribute AllowMultipleValues="" AllowedValueLength="" AttributeDomainID="" AttributeGroupID=""AttributeID="ForRenewal" AttributeKey=""
                           AttributePostFix="" DataType="" DerivedFromAttributeKey="" IsAllowedValueDefined="" IsValueMandatory="" LongDescription="" 
                           OrganizationCode="" SequenceNo="" ShortDescription="" ForRenewal="N"/>
                  </CustomAttributes>
            ...
      </Order>
        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetOverallStatusUE
            This user exit is called if any element in the output template has the OverallStatus attribute. It is invoked for each order if that order's template element or that order's order line template element contains the OverallStatus attribute.
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSConvertCurrencyUE
            This user exit is called only if the Output Template has any of the following elements below
            • LineOverallTotalsInEnterpriseCurrency
            • LineRemainingTotalsInEnterpriseCurrency
            • OverallTotalsInEnterpriseCurrency
            • PriceInfoInEnterpriseCurrency
            • RemainingTotalsInEnterpriseCurrency

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetFundsAvailableUE
            When all of the conditions below are met, this user exit is called for each payment method whose payment type has ChargeUpToAvailable set to Y
            • The Input has the GetFundsAvailable flag set to Y
            • The Output template contains the FundsAvailable attribute at the PaymentMethod element
          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
            This user exit is called only if the output template has ItemDetails element under OrderLine element.

          Events Raised: None

          Audits: None

          Pre-conditions: None

          Post-conditions: None

          Output Template Support:
          Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

          Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. Contains attributes of the order for which details must be returned. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details of the order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
